roleset.name: move in a swinging or fluttering motion
roleset.note: BAT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bat' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 17.1 and 40.3.2, Framenet entry Body movement. (from bat.01-v predicate notes)
BATTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on bat-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls crane-40.3.2. (from batting.01-n)

example.name: with predication
example.text: Mike-1, *PRO*-1 off balance, managed *PRO*-1 to bat the muzzle away amoment before it exploded.

example.name: Both args, with GOL
example.text: Glad to hear you didn't completely fall for his batting his eyelashes at you.

example.name: semi-idiomatic
example.text: Your goal here is for your lights to be inconspicuous, so that you can slide right past Johnny Law's cold gaze without his batting an eye.

roleset.name: play baseball, earning stats
roleset.note: BATTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, bat-v.02. Sort of Corresponds to VNcls throw-17.1-1. (from batting.02-n)

example.name: ey, batta batta
example.text: The A-men batting Nos. 6 through 9, a.k.a. the ``bottom of the order,'' got seven of their team's 11 hits and scored four of its runs in a 5-0 decision.
example.arg: Nos. 6 through 9, a.k.a. the ``bottom of the order,''

example.name: arg1 as statistic
example.text: Ortiz's season included a succession of splashy hits and ended with his batting .300, with 47 homers, a major-league-best 148 R.B.I., 119 runs ...
example.arg: with 47 homers, a major-league-best 148 R.B.I., 119 runs

example.name: arg1 as lineup position
example.text: His batting 6th just puts a tremendous suckhole in the middle of the lineup and only assures us that he will get more opportunities to suck with the bases loaded.

roleset.name: bring in runs by hitting a baseball

example.name: more baseball
example.text: They combined for 25 hits, six home runs and [24 runs]*-1 batted in [*-1]in the five games against the Cubs.

roleset.name: play baseball, earning runs or other score markers
roleset.note: BATTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based loosely on bat-v.03 (but expanded). Corresponds to VNcls throw-17.1-1. (from batting.03-n)

roles.note: Usage may be metaphorical. Arg1 from the verb frame has been split here in to 2 args for increased accuracy, and accommodation of a broader range of usages. (from batting.03-n)

example.name: all args
example.text: their batting the ball for a total of 20 hits...
